Quick search

Developper Section¶

class tuba.define_geometry.TubaPoint(x, y, z, name='', nocount=False)[source]¶

Containes all information present at a POINT in the piping/rod network

It is important to note that each tubapoint inside a piping is always an attribute of two vectors, one time as start_tubapoint, one time as end_tubapoint.

Furthermore each tubapoint can only be endpoint for a single vector but startpoint for as many vectors as wished.

get_last_vector()[source]¶

checks if the given tubapoint is a icident_end_tubapoint and as well start_tubapoint of a vector.

is_element_end()[source]¶

checks if the given tubapoint is a end_tubapoint and as well start_tubapoint of a vector. If false, this means that it’s the end of the piping

is_element_start()[source]¶

checks if the given tubapoint is a start_tubapoint and as well end_tubapoint of a vector. If false, this means that it’s the beginning of the piping

is_incident_end()[source]¶

checks if the given tubapoint is a icident_end_tubapoint and as well start_tubapoint of a vector.

class tuba.define_geometry.TubaVector(start_tubapoint, end_tubapoint, vector, name_vector)[source]¶

TubVector is the Class to contain all information present on a LINE ELEMENT in the piping/rod network
